Name: Stool Decorated with Plants Signifying Union of Egypt
Description: The stool belonged to King Tutankhamun when he was a child. The feet, in the form of lion's paws, are made of wood painted white. Between them is a gilded openwork wooden decoration in the form of lotus and papyrus entwined around the hieroglyphic sign Sema, which signifies the "Union of the Two Lands." A cushion would have been placed on the curved seat.
